project.teaser: The project supports the policy dialogue including formal meetings, monitoring and agenda setting, capacity building and implementation of the EU's Western Balkan Agenda, as well as the aligning of thematic priorities. It implements regional pilot activities and upgrades an...
project.objective: The project supports the policy dialogue including formal meetings, monitoring and agenda setting, capacity building and implementation of the EU's Western Balkan Agenda, as well as the aligning of thematic priorities. It implements regional pilot activities and upgrades an information hub based on the wbc-rti.info platform. 14 partner organisations, representing network nodes in the region and EU expert organisation, support policy dialogue through ministerial meetings, Steering Platform meetings and ad-hoc policy meetings. They provide analytical evidence via monitoring and mapping activities (of the stakeholder ecosystem, implementation of the Western Balkans Agenda and integration to the European Research Area) and foresight. POLICY ANSWERS also allows for tailored and targeted capacity building activities in the Western Balkans as well as regional alignment in relation to the digital transformation, the green agenda and towards healthy societies. Pilot activities provide learning opportunities on policy and programme level and reach out to final beneficiaries related to improved academia-industry cooperation, researcher mobility, youth, promotion of research infrastructures and increased innovation skills in all areas. The project builds on existing information hubs (for example, wbc-rti.info) and continues services such as regular newsletters, media relations, production of infographics and multimedia content. Special emphasis will be put on the inclusion of underrepresented groups and the coordination with key stakeholders and international organisations.

result.title: D4.2 Collection of Policy briefs on Green Deal across all policy areas
result.description: Deliverable 4.2 presents the recommendation for creating an effective WB Roadmap and Regional Action plan in line with the wider EU targets for climate action and environmental protection with sustainable economy and new job creation It is due after two-and-a-half years of the project, but further updated until its end when a revised version will be submitted.

result.title: D3.2 Compilation of work programmes
result.description: Deliverable 3.2 includes the summary of the work programmes developed for the implementation of capacity building activities in the WB. The programmes are developed by the task leaders (with support of IMP and ZSI) on the basis of the methodology presented in Deliverable 3.1. Each work programme will describe target groups, activities, monitoring and evaluation plan. The work programmes are updated in m20 and m31.

result.title: D2.4 Report on foresight findings
result.description: Deliverable 2.4 describes the methodology used in the Task 2.4 and the results of the Workshop carried out. There will also be the achievements of the measures and discussions laid out in the report; input to the policy briefs (Task 2.5) is also described.

result.title: D5.1 Plan for providng financial incentives for academia-industry and researcher mobility collaboration
result.description: Deliverable 51 provides an overview of existing good practices in the WB region and EU MSs a detailed activity plan for implementing the grants to third parties for enhancing academiaindustry collaboration with clearly set deadlines risk analysis draft rules and procedures for implementing the open call and draft contract for the beneficiaries

result.title: D4.1 Collection of Policy briefs on Digital Transition across all policy areas
result.description: Deliverable 4.1 outlines the best practices with recommendations for effective implementation of various strategies, e-services and for overcoming legislative and business barriers. The descriptions are due after two years of the project in initial versions to allow a focus, but further updated until its end (when a revised version is made available).

result.title: D4.3 Collection of Policy briefs on Healthy societies across all policy areas
result.description: Deliverable 4.3 analyses national development policies and provides recommendations for strengthening healthcare in the WBs for the health of citizens and for the development of a sustainable economy. It is due after three-and-a-half years of the project, but further updated until its end when a revised version might be submitted.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - POLICY ANSWERS (R&I POLICY making, implementation ANd Support in the WEsteRn BalkanS)
result.teaser: POLICY ANSWERS facilitates policy dialogue among the European Commission, EU Member States, and the Western Balkans (WB), primarily focusing on Research and Innovation (R&I), and additionally encompassing Education, Culture, Youth, and Sports.Key priorities of the European...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: D5.3 Report on promotors for research infrastructures
result.description: Deliverable 5.3 provides guidelines for the effective use of national and international research infrastructures; outlines the best practices with recommendations for creating open access to national and regional RIs; presents the best cases of newly developed RIs or those under development and provides a guideline for the further development of the pan-European RI SEEIIST etc. as it summarises work done in Task 5.3.

result.title: D7.2 Data Management Plan
result.description: Deliverable 72 describes the datasets produced in the project rules and responsibilities for managing them The DMP will be updated together with the regular project reportingthe deliverable will be updated in m20 and m38

result.title: D3.1 Methodology for identifying capacity building topics/priorities
result.description: Deliverable 31 includes the process and guidelines for identification of capacity building topics in WB economies The methodology takes into account preliminary planning as presented in the tasks as well as further concrete steps in the assessment of national needs in accordance with the thematic priorities of the WB agenda European Green Deal Europe fit for the digital age or an economy that connects and works for people

result.title: D5.2 Report on regional innovation academy and support
result.description: Deliverable 5.2 reports on the activities of the academy, i.e. the variety of content and forms of educational resources collected, selected, recorded and provided on the platform as well as on the actions undertaken to promote them. It will provide statistics about the students and their achievements. Furthermore, the report includes information about the policy fellowships and their engagement.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
